After Bug 659972, it is difficult for users/developers to know whether or not this is a beta build or not. The only way to tell is when they switch from Firefox 4 or Aurora/Nightly to Beta, as a new tab "welcome to Firefox 5, you are running Firefox beta". 

While this is informative, it will be more useful if the information is located in the "About window". 



Reproducible: Always

comments.text:
We intend for Firefox beta to look exactly the same as Firefox release. In an ideal world the last beta and the release are the exact same bits. Any behavior change between the two has the potential to invalidate testing for the release bits.

I wouldn't be adverse to the about window showing the fact that you are on the beta channel in dynamically though, but that seems to already be there on my machine.

comments.raw_text:
I realized something while updating Firefox 6 beta a while back ago. Firefox 6 beta did not become Firefox 6 Release, instead it became Firefox 7 beta. 

This further proves that making Beta look visually different from Release is a better choice, because it will never become stable product. 
Moreover, the fact that it shows "You are currently on the beta update channel", suggests that Firefox X Beta Will never become Firefox X Release.

Hence, I believe it is to the best interest of users that we change the word "Firefox" in the Firefox button to become "Beta"(similar to Aurora and Nightly). 

Why this change is good:
1. Reduce chances of confusion
2. Clear to users that this is a beta software
3. Shows developer/users that this software will always be a beta software, enabling them to do testing on add-ons/website/apps/plug-ins more easily.

If you think that this bug is a waste of time because it only touch on cosmetic changes in a beta software, please feel free to close the bug(hence marking it WONTFIX) and keep to the status quo. 

(Please forgive me if I sound rude.Thank You)
